Issues.Title: Add phone breakpoint
Issues.Body:
This is an improvement in the way that the PR adds another breakpoint called `phone` which reaches from 0 to 480 px and redefines `mobile` to reach from 481 to 768 px. It enables users to differentiate between tablets in portrait mode and phones in portrait mode. Almost every smartphone at the time of the writing has not more than 480 px width in portrait mode.

### Proposed solution

The PR adds a new variable `$mobile` to base all the breakpoint-related rules on it.

### Tradeoffs

I might have missed a logical rule in `sass/grid/columns.sass` lines 576 to 579 to enable `mobile-only` classes. In my own extension of Bulma 0.9.0 I used the following rules:

```sass
.columns
  &.is-phone
    display: flex
  +mobile-only
    &.is-mobile-only
      display: flex
  +phone
    &.is-mobile-only
      display: block
    &.is-phone
      display: flex
```

### Testing Done

Included in a customized Bulma build and tested there by creating a test page showing off all the breakpoint relevant classes in action.

### Changelog updated?

No. As I’m unsure if it ever gets merged and which version is in that case the right one.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add phone breakpoint" (#3058)

Issues.Title: Unable to change all media queries values seamlessly
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma | the Docs**.


### Overview of the problem

Is there anyway to change all media queries for every class using one variable?

For example, any is-4, is-7 etc. classes on columns will always use a media min-width of 769px despite attempts to change the $tablet variable. 

Since $tablet has default value of $769px, which matches up with the media min-width values, it is assumed this is the var to change the min width values in the media queiries.

### Steps to Reproduce

Please use the following block of HTML as an example:

```
@media screen and (min-width: 769px), print
.columns:not(.is-desktop) {
    display: flex;
}
```

or 

```
@media screen and (min-width: 769px), print
.column.is-12, .column.is-12-tablet {
    flex: none;
    width: 100%;
}

```

is-6, is-4 etc. would have the same media queries where min-width is 769px

The docs say any modified variable e.g. $desktop or $tablet must be done BEFORE bulma is imported so in the scss file, we have this as well:

```
$tablet: 992px;
@import '~bulma/bulma.sass';

```

### Expected behavior

The media queries for .columns, .column, is-12 etc. should be applied to min-width: 992px;

### Actual behavior

The media query still gets applied to min-width: 769px.

Hence, changing the $tablet variable does not seem to work.

I thought that was the correct variable to modify since it's default value is $769px which matches up with what the media queries initially say.

perhaps it is not - if that is the case, how does one change the values in which media queries active for application of is-4-mobile, is-6, is-mobile etc?
